hasPart.text: California has a "Basic Speed Law," which means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. Even if your speed is slower than the posted limit, you may still be cited if you are going too fast for conditions. When deciding how quickly to drive, drivers should take multiple factors into account, such as the speed of surrounding vehicles, the condition of the road surface, the presence of bicyclists and pedestrians, and weather conditions.

about.name: Trucks' blind spots are:

hasPart.assesses: Trucks' blind spots are: | Trucks' blind spots are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A truck's blind spots are much larger than a smaller car’s blind spots. The driver cannot see your car behind their vehicle and you can't see what’s happening in traffic ahead if you're driving too closely behind the truck. Whether you are driving behind or to the side of the truck, if you can’t see the driver’s face in their side view mirror, then they can’t see you.

suggestedAnswer.text: Directly behind the body.

comment.text: Directly behind the body.

suggestedAnswer.text: On the immediate left of the cab.

comment.text: On the immediate left of the cab.

suggestedAnswer.text: Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.

comment.text: Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.

acceptedAnswer.text: Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.

comment.text: Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.

answerExplanation.text: A truck's blind spots are much larger than a smaller car’s blind spots. The driver cannot see your car behind their vehicle and you can't see what’s happening in traffic ahead if you're driving too closely behind the truck. Whether you are driving behind or to the side of the truck, if you can’t see the driver’s face in their side view mirror, then they can’t see you.
